cors.description: Due to browser security restrictions, you need to configure Ollama for cross-origin access to work properly.

linux.env: Under the [Service] section, add `Environment` and add the OLLAMA_ORIGINS environment variable:
linux.systemd: Invoke systemd to edit the ollama service:

cors.macos: Open the 'Terminal' application and paste the following command, then press enter to run
cors.reboot: Please restart the Ollama service after completing the execution
cors.title: Configure Ollama to Allow Cross-Origin Access
cors.windows: On Windows, click 'Control Panel', enter the 'Edit system environment variables' section. Create a new environment variable for your user account named 'OLLAMA_ORIGINS' with a value of '*', and click 'OK/Apply' to save

install.description: Make sure you have Ollama running. If you haven't downloaded Ollama, please visit the official website <1>download</1>
install.docker: If you prefer to use Docker, Ollama also provides official Docker images which you can pull with the following command:

linux.manual: Alternatively, you can refer to the <1>Linux manual installation guide</1> for self-installation

install.title: Install and Start Ollama Locally
